snippet: A lawyer told the Federal Communications Commission that Verizon might have collected more than $240 million from false charges, more than four times the amount it agreed to refund.
abstract: Independent telecommunications lawyer files petition with Federal Communications Commission, claiming that Verizon Wireless vastly understated amount it collected from false data charges on customer bills when it agreed to refund levies in 2010; says carrier might have collected more than $240 million from charges, more than four time amount it agreed upon.
lead_paragraph: A lawyer told the Federal Communications Commission that Verizon might have collected more than $240 million from false charges, more than four times the amount it agreed to refund.

headline.main: F.C.C. Is Told Verizon Underpaid Data Refunds
headline.print_headline: F.C.C. Is Told Verizon Underpaid Data Refunds
